channel.title: Golang Weekly
channel.description: A weekly newsletter about the Go programming language

item.title: „ÄêErrors, errors, and errors again„ÄëÈîôËØØ„ÄÅÈîôËØØ„ÄÅÂÜçÈîôËØØ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã510 ‚Äî June 11, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

An Applied Introduction to eBPF with Go ‚Äî eBPF is a technology that allows running sandboxed programs within the Linux kernel, enabling a wide range of advanced networking, security, and observability capabilities. This post covers two examples of using eBPF to monitor system calls and incoming IP¬†packets.

Ozan Sazak

Build Go Apps That Scale on AWS ‚Äî Learn how to build and deploy scalable applications to AWS using Go. This detailed video course will cover AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, JSON Web Tokens, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

The Profile-Guided Optimization Experience at Grab ‚Äî First, Dolt showed us their wins using Go 1.21+‚Äôs profile-guided optimization (PGO) feature. Then Cloudflare needed 97 fewer CPU cores thanks to it. Now, folks working on Southeast Asia‚Äôs leading ‚Äòsuperapp‚Äô, Grab, show off their wins and learnings, along with the Dockerfile used to make it¬†happen.

Hu and Sharma (Grab)

QUICK BITS:

  • üïπÔ∏è The popular Go-powered 2D game engine Ebitengine runs frequent game jams where you get two weeks to build an Ebitengine-powered game. The next one starts this Saturday (June 15).

  • üá¨üáß GopherCon UK is back for 2024 in London on August 14-16.

  • Go 1.22.4 was released containing security and bug¬†fixes.

Go Error Propagation and API Contracts ‚Äî Not another rant about error verbosity in Go, but an example-driven plea to be more intentional with handling errors returned from other functions your code calls. Luckily, you have several options, but any choice should be intentional and¬†apropos.

Matt T. Proud

Error Flows in Go ‚Äî Sticking to the theme of errors! Last year, Preslav wrote Go‚Äôs Error Handling is a Form of Storytelling ‚Äì here‚Äôs the followup, where he stresses the importance of fleshing out the context of what caused an error, since ‚ÄúX failed‚Äù is often no help at¬†all.

Preslav Rachev

Sentinel Errors and errors.Is() Slow Your Code Down by..¬†500%? ‚Äî Not exactly, but it seems errors in Go are an endless source of discussion lately. The benchmarks here are interesting but you need to use a critical eye, as always. If you need every bit of performance, though, there could be a spot to¬†squeeze.

Zach Musgrave (DoltHub)

Hookdeck: The AWS API Gateway + Amazon EventBridge Alternative ‚Äî Receive, authenticate, transform, filter, route, & send events across your EDA with an event gateway for engineering¬†teams.

Hookdeck sponsor

How to Build and Deploy a Telegram Bot with Kamal ‚Äî The bot is written in Go, but deployed using Kamal, a container based deployment tool fresh from the Ruby¬†world.

Kyrylo Silin

üìÑ Things You Wish You Didn't Need to Know About S3 Daniel Grzelak

üì∫ Creating a Distributed File Storage System in Go Anthony GG

üõ† Code & Tools

Gowebly: A CLI to Build Web Apps with Go ‚Äî Put together the fundamentals of a basic full-stack webapp quickly with this. Supports Go frameworks like Fiber, Gin, and Echo, but also brings things like htmx, Hyperscript, Tailwind CSS, and Alpine.js into play. Live reloading, too! GitHub¬†repo.

Gowebly

Announcing GoReleaser v2 ‚Äî A tool for releasing Go projects with cross-compilation, releasing to systems like GitHub and GitLab, nightly builds, image creation, etc. v2 removes lots of deprecated features so you need to take care when upgrading ‚Äì GitHub¬†repo.

Carlos Becker

xstrings: String Functions Used in Other Languages But Absent in Go ‚Äî Lots to enjoy here, such as ‚Äòcentering‚Äô strings, changing between different casing systems, partitioning strings, counting words, reversal, etc.

Huan Du

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Your fastest path to production. With Render, you can build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

üêò PostgreSQL user? We have a newsletter for that.

Stateless: A Fluent Library for Creating State Machines ‚Äî It supports almost the same API as a similar project in¬†C#.

Quim Muntal

Tokenizer: Pure Go Implementation of OpenAI's Tokenizer ‚Äî When you use OpenAI‚Äôs GPT, input and output is delivered in ‚Äòtokens‚Äô which are not the same as characters, syllables or words, but somewhere in¬†between.

Wahlmann and Wendt

  • Go Micro 5.0 ‚Äì Go microservices¬†framework. Notably, it switches from Apache 2.0 licensing to the Business Source License (BSL)..

  • Vale 3.5 ‚Äì A linter for natural¬†language/prose. Now with support for linting comments in Go, Rust, Python, Ruby, C/C++, JavaScript, TypeScript, YAML, and¬†CSS¬†files.

  • GoCV 0.37 ‚Äì The Go bindings for OpenCV 4 now support OpenCV¬†4.10.0.

  • Piko 0.3 ‚Äì Reverse proxy for local services / open alternative to¬†Ngrok.

  • jqp 0.7 ‚Äì A Go-powered TUI playground to experiment with jq.

  • pgweb 0.16 ‚Äì Cross-platform client for Postgres¬†databases.

  • raft 1.7 ‚Äì Go implementation of the Raft consensus¬†protocol.

  • go-elasticsearch 8.14 ‚Äì Official Elasticsearch client¬†library.

„Äë

#‚Äã510 ‚Äî June 11, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

An Applied Introduction to eBPF with Go ‚Äî eBPF is a technology that allows running sandboxed programs within the Linux kernel, enabling a wide range of advanced networking, security, and observability capabilities. This post covers two examples of using eBPF to monitor system calls and incoming IP¬†packets.

Ozan Sazak

Build Go Apps That Scale on AWS ‚Äî Learn how to build and deploy scalable applications to AWS using Go. This detailed video course will cover AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, JSON Web Tokens, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Then Cloudflare needed 97 fewer CPU cores thanks to it. Now, folks working on Southeast Asia‚Äôs leading ‚Äòsuperapp‚Äô, Grab, show off their wins and learnings, along with the Dockerfile used to make it¬†happen.

  • Go 1.22.4 was released containing security and bug¬†fixes.

Preslav Rachev

The benchmarks here are interesting but you need to use a critical eye, as always. If you need every bit of performance, though, there could be a spot to¬†squeeze.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

  • Go Micro 5.0 ‚Äì Go microservices¬†framework. Notably, it switches from Apache 2.0 licensing to the Business Source License (BSL)..

  • Vale 3.5 ‚Äì A linter for natural¬†language/prose. Now with support for linting comments in Go, Rust, Python, Ruby, C/C++, JavaScript, TypeScript, YAML, and¬†CSS¬†files.

  • GoCV 0.37 ‚Äì The Go bindings for OpenCV 4 now support OpenCV¬†4.10.0.

  • pgweb 0.16 ‚Äì Cross-platform client for Postgres¬†databases.

  • raft 1.7 ‚Äì Go implementation of the Raft consensus¬†protocol.

  • go-elasticsearch 8.14 ‚Äì Official Elasticsearch client¬†library.

item.title: „ÄêWriting generic collection types„ÄëÁºñÂÜôÊ≥õÂûãÈõÜÂêàÁ±ªÂûã
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã513 ‚Äî July 2, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Writing Generic Collection Types: The Missing Documentation ‚Äî Go 1.18 introduced generics, but the author found practical examples and documentation on creating generic collections to be lacking. Luckily, he‚Äôs done the experimentation for us and shares what he learnt after many hours of spinning his wheels on the¬†problem.

Zach Musgrave

Realtime Diagnostic Logging (or 'How to Really Spy on Your Go Web Apps') ‚Äî An exploration of some options to temporarily enable verbose logging for troubleshooting purposes and making those logs accessible from anywhere and in¬†real-time.

Vladimir Dementyev

Go! Unlock Your Tech Potential with Ardan Labs Consulting ‚Äî Struggling with skill gaps, development speed or complex tech challenges? Ardan Labs specializes in Go, Rust, Docker and K8s to accelerate your software development, optimize architecture, and manage tech debt. Let us supercharge your¬†team!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • ü§ñ Russ Cox is working on a bot to help automate tasks in the Go issue¬†tracker. The bot is called Gaby and you can learn more about it¬†here.

  • ‚úñÔ∏é Tic-Tac-TUI? A Bubble Tea-powered, TUI-based 'noughts and crosses' game, all written in¬†Go.

  • üá¶üá∫ GopherConAU 2024 takes place in Sydney this November and its CFP is now open until September¬†15.

How to Use a Go Library on a Web Page with WebAssembly ‚Äî Compiling Go code to WebAssembly opens up some interesting opportunities in the¬†browser.

Thomas Derflinger

üìÑ f-tests as a Replacement for Table-Driven Tests in Go Aliaksandr Valialkin

üìÑ How to Do 'Hotword' Detection with Streaming Speech-to-Text and Go ‚Äì Leans on AssemblyAI‚Äôs¬†platform. Yasoob Khalid

üìÑ A Silly Mistake I Made with io.TeeReader Vishnu Bharathi

üìÑ gRPC: The Good Parts Kevin McDonald

üõ† Code & Tools

River: A Fast, Robust Job Queue for Go ‚Äî A Postgres-backed background job system that encourages using the same database for your app and your jobs. v0.8 just landed, but the biggest recent addition is River UI, a way to more directly monitor and visualize what River is up¬†to.

Brandur Leach et al.

SmoothMQ: A Drop-in Replacement for Amazon SQS ‚Äî Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a distributed message queuing service offered as part of AWS. SmoothMQ offers the same API but in a single Go¬†binary.

Jay Goel

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

üç™¬†Cookie: Cookies, But With Structs ‚Äî Set, get, and remove cookies, both plaintext and¬†signed.

Chase Pierce

  • lo 1.44 ‚Äì Lodash-style Go library offering generic functions over slices, maps, channels,¬†etc.

  • Chi 5.1 ‚Äì Popular composable router for building Go HTTP¬†services.

  • Vitess 20 ‚Äì Go-powered horizontal scaling approach for MySQL.

  • üìä go-echarts 2.4 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization¬†library.

  • GoBGP 3.28 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

  • fx 35.0 ‚Äì Powerful terminal JSON¬†viewer.

üéÅ And one for fun

Doggo: A Go-Powered Command Line DNS Client ‚Äî A DNS tool written in Go designed to be used at the terminal (not as a library). Well presented and a good example of a modern, Go-powered CLI tool. GitHub¬†repo.

Karan Sharma

„Äë

#‚Äã513 ‚Äî July 2, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Luckily, he‚Äôs done the experimentation for us and shares what he learnt after many hours of spinning his wheels on the¬†problem.

Ardan Labs specializes in Go, Rust, Docker and K8s to accelerate your software development, optimize architecture, and manage tech debt. Let us supercharge your¬†team!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

  • ü§ñ Russ Cox is working on a bot to help automate tasks in the Go issue¬†tracker. The bot is called Gaby and you can learn more about it¬†here.

  • üá¶üá∫ GopherConAU 2024 takes place in Sydney this November and its CFP is now open until September¬†15.

Thomas Derflinger

üìÑ A Silly Mistake I Made with io.TeeReader Vishnu Bharathi

üìÑ gRPC: The Good Parts Kevin McDonald

Brandur Leach et al.

Jay Goel

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

üç™¬†Cookie: Cookies, But With Structs ‚Äî Set, get, and remove cookies, both plaintext and¬†signed.

Chase Pierce

  • lo 1.44 ‚Äì Lodash-style Go library offering generic functions over slices, maps, channels,¬†etc.

  • Chi 5.1 ‚Äì Popular composable router for building Go HTTP¬†services.

  • Vitess 20 ‚Äì Go-powered horizontal scaling approach for MySQL.

  • üìä go-echarts 2.4 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization¬†library.

  • GoBGP 3.28 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

  • fx 35.0 ‚Äì Powerful terminal JSON¬†viewer.

üéÅ And one for fun

Doggo: A Go-Powered Command Line DNS Client ‚Äî A DNS tool written in Go designed to be used at the terminal (not as a library). Well presented and a good example of a modern, Go-powered CLI tool. GitHub¬†repo.

item.title: „ÄêA quick Go quiz„ÄëÂø´ÈÄü Go ÊµãÈ™å
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã511 ‚Äî June 18, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Why People are 'Angry' Over Go 1.23 Iterators ‚Äî ‚ÄòAngry‚Äô feels overstated to us, but there‚Äôs been a lot of robust debate about Go‚Äôs proposed new iterator helpers (see them in action here) on social media this week (e.g. Reddit). There‚Äôs a broad mix of opinions, and the creator of the Odin language chimes in with his thoughts, opining that Go should stay unapologetically¬†imperative.

Ginger Bill

üí° Chris Siebenmann chimes in too, acknowledging the complexity of the problem, but how Go's solution has benefits in terms of reducing potential¬†errors.

A Quiz on Advanced Concepts for Go Developers ‚Äî Someone made a quiz on Go concepts if you‚Äôd like to test your chops. Twelve quick multiple choice questions¬†await.

martialdouble-t

Redis With Wings. Better Performance. Less¬†Overhead ‚Äî Dragonfly (24k GitHub stars) is a fully compatible drop-in Redis replacement. Dragonfly achieves 25X better performance than Redis and supports millions of QPS on a single instance. Download and deploy yourself or get a free trial of Dragonfly¬†Cloud.

Dragonfly sponsor

Putting Go's context Into Context ‚Äî A romp through various types of context, from empty to WithDeadline, because ‚Äúthe real beauty is on the inside‚Äù, claims the¬†author.

Abin Simon

Common Anti-Patterns in Go Web Apps ‚Äî An interesting checklist to consider to ensure you don't slip into unhelpful patterns and, instead, write loosely coupled code that keeps everyone productive and¬†happy.

Mi≈Çosz Sm√≥≈Çka

üìÑ Performance Benchmarking: gRPC + Protobuf vs. HTTP + JSON Alex Pliutau

üìÑ Go is a Platform ‚Äì A gushing reminder of how everything that comes with Go out-of-the-box forms a comprehensive suite of evolving developer¬†tools. Elton Minetto

üìÑ UUIDv7 Implemented in 20 Languages ‚Äì Surprisingly short and¬†sweet. Anton Zhiyanov

üõ† Code & Tools

Goyave v5.0: Another REST-Based Go Web Framework ‚Äî One of many players in this space, but one that's undergone a significant revamp over the past year. The emphasis is on providing an opinionated, defined structure and architecture for 'enterprise' tier apps. (Official¬†homepage.)

J√©r√©my LAMBERT

Dynamo 2.0: An Expressive Amazon DynamoDB Library ‚Äî Integrates with the official AWS SDK but gives you a tidier abstraction. v2.0 uses aws-sdk-go-v2 under the hood and while it maintains an almost identical API, there are a handful of small changes that may require you update your¬†code.

Greg Roseberry

Temporal for Startups ‚Äî Startups: Ship fast with Temporal. Guaranteed reliability. Code in your language. Get $2,400 free credits & expert advice to accelerate¬†success.

Temporal Technologies sponsor

Age 1.2: A Simple File Encryption Tool and Go Library ‚Äî Boasts small explicit keys, no config options, and UNIX-style¬†composability.

Filippo Valsorda

tbls: A CI-Friendly Tool for Documenting Databases ‚Äî Document a database automatically in Markdown format with schemas rendered via DOT, PlantUML, Mermaid, or direct to images. By default you get documentation covering columns, indexes, relations, and other schema details (here‚Äôs a¬†sample).

Ken‚Äôichiro Oyama

dblab: An Interactive Client for Postgres, MySQL, and SQLite3 ‚Äî A cross-platform (including Windows) TUI-style app for working with various database systems. Certainly looks rather different to typical CLI¬†clients.

Daniel Omar Vergara P√©rez

jsondiff 0.6: JSON Diffing Library Based on RFC 6902 (JSON¬†Patch) ‚Äî RFC 6902 defines a JSON structure for expressing patching operations on other JSON¬†documents.

William Poussier

  • TinyGo 0.32.0 ‚Äì The Go compiler for 'small places', like microcontrollers and WebAssembly. v0.32.0 supports LLVM 18, drops Go 1.18 support, and supports more new¬†hardware.

  • validator 10.22 ‚Äì Value validations for structs and fields based on¬†tags.

  • Cloudflare Go 2.3 ‚Äì Official library for the Cloudflare API.

  • NATS.go 1.36 ‚Äì Go client for the NATS messaging¬†system.

  • dae 0.6 ‚Äì High-perf transparent proxy based on¬†eBPF.

  • Buf 1.33 ‚Äì CLI tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers.

  • Pond 1.9 ‚Äì Minimalist goroutine worker¬†pool.

„Äë

#‚Äã511 ‚Äî June 18, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Why People are 'Angry' Over Go 1.23 Iterators ‚Äî ‚ÄòAngry‚Äô feels overstated to us, but there‚Äôs been a lot of robust debate about Go‚Äôs proposed new iterator helpers (see them in action here) on social media this week (e.g. Reddit). There‚Äôs a broad mix of opinions, and the creator of the Odin language chimes in with his thoughts, opining that Go should stay unapologetically¬†imperative.

Greg Roseberry

Temporal Technologies sponsor

Filippo Valsorda

Ken‚Äôichiro Oyama

Daniel Omar Vergara P√©rez

William Poussier

  • TinyGo 0.32.0 ‚Äì The Go compiler for 'small places', like microcontrollers and WebAssembly. v0.32.0 supports LLVM 18, drops Go 1.18 support, and supports more new¬†hardware.

  • validator 10.22 ‚Äì Value validations for structs and fields based on¬†tags.

  • Cloudflare Go 2.3 ‚Äì Official library for the Cloudflare API.

  • NATS.go 1.36 ‚Äì Go client for the NATS messaging¬†system.

  • dae 0.6 ‚Äì High-perf transparent proxy based on¬†eBPF.

  • Buf 1.33 ‚Äì CLI tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers.

  • Pond 1.9 ‚Äì Minimalist goroutine worker¬†pool.

item.title: „ÄêGo 1.23 gets another step closer„ÄëGo 1.23 ÂèàÂêëÂâçËøàËøõ‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÊ≠•
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã512 ‚Äî June 25, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

‚úàÔ∏è I've produced this issue a day early due to being en-route to the AI Engineer World's Fair, so any last minute news may be missed. If you're there, come and say hi, but you can also watch from afar through the livestreams that will be on YouTube this Wednesday and Thursday. See you again next¬†week!
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

Go Weekly

Three Ways to Think About Channels ‚Äî Channels seem trivial on the surface, but actually using them requires an understanding of Go's entire concurrency ecosystem. With such an understanding, you can pick the right primitives for your use case and not end up trapped in a world of¬†deadlocks.

Max Hoffman (DoltHub)
